As David already mentioned writing a Runner is not really a big deal. I do =
it on a regular basis ;-)

A runner that creates a suite from a set of name=
s should be straightforward given you can compute the number of tests befor=
ehand, eg. because the class can already be loaded or you know the names of=
 test methods per class from some other source.

You might want to look at =
org.junit.runners.Suite for an example.

Johannes
